comment: Her course itself is easy and its very few work you get graded on so you will pass as long as you do everything! NOW, if you are looking for a hands on teacher she is not that, it took her a quit a while to respond, due to her doing a research of her own. The class itself no way hard, its factly extremely easy but the difficulty is communication.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: I wouldn't recommend this professor. She waits until the very end to release grades and is completely unreachable throughout the semester. She left her class confused due to lack of guidance and communication. Her course feels like a joke.

I do not recommend taking Dr. Stephens. She NEVER responds to emails. She also posts grades months after turning in assignments. There is a discussion every week, but you will not see those grades until the end of the semester for no reason. Directions for some assignments are not clear. She takes points off of assignments for the smallest reasons.

There is no way to get an A+ in this class. I wrote at least 1 - 2 pages per discussion, referenced the textbook, and provided substantive answers only to receive a 60% for "course coverage." I was also the ONLY one to provide answers like these, so I am assuming that everyone else made a 20% or 0% on course coverage.  HORRIBLE INSTRUCTOR!!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: 2nd day of class and I'm already spending MORE time on understanding her ridiculous syllabus than I am learning ANYTHING! Two types of discussion boards, with NO guidance or clear understanding. All documents broken up and scattered, AND they contradict each other! I'm so confused and disappointed. I should be learning, not decoding gibberish!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Prof. was difficult, many complained. one of the hardest classes I've taken & got a B, don't think I deserved a B. Prof. gets confused, students definitely need to stay on top of things, would encourage to get assig. completed when they're published bc i can be easily missed. I'd take her again & would be prepared, since I know what to expect.
Dont let the 4/5 fool you. This is one of the worst experiences Ive had with a professor. Take ANYONE ELSE! The entire course is so confusing even SHE gets confused. Dont waste your time and money.

Awarded for worst professor @KSU. Do not take for 3354. Didnt grade anything until 2 weeks before the semester was over. Quizzes come directly from textbook so you must read it to "understand the concept". Had so many problems we didnt even know what we were supposed to do some weeks. Stuff is due Thurs-Sun consecutively. An entire headache.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Does not care about student's grades. We didn't take a quiz and she never graded my short answer one and it got put into the final grade book as a 0% and 80%. She doesn't put the grades in for your project and attendance until the day before grades are due and doesn't grade attendance right. But all quizzes are on quizlet, only good thing.

This professor does not care about student's grades. She assigns work and then ignores it till the end of the semester. She answers half of your questions if she does, usually with a lie. Class is unorganized and she assigns a group project but if people drop out in your group you are forced to do the project alone, doesn't follow syllabus either.

Overall easy work. I took this class online. You have a quiz every Friday and no lockdown browser. However, the teacher is very hard to reach and she can be confusing at times. Doesn't grade fast either. Every week an assigned group of students has to write an essay. Your group only has to do it once tho. The work is easy tho.

She's really sweet and her lectures were nice! Weekly quiz and discussion board, textbook reading matters! The major assignment is writing a group essay for a chapter. Only 2 tests (midterm and final), very responsive and willing to help students, grades things last minute though. Attendance and discussion board participation really matter.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment:
Her online courses are not well organized and it is confusing trying to find the course material. 
You work with an assigned group for most of the semester. One group posts on the discussion board each week and a group essay/project is due at the end of semester.
She is difficult to reach and puts in grades one day before they are due.

The class was easy enough, all the quizzes were on quizlet. We had discussions every week with one group leading each week. One thing I will say is that prof Stephens is horrible at answering emails..even through d2l she'll take upwards of 3 days to get back to you. It was very irritating

She is hard to get of ahold of and waits to till the last minute to grade. Instructions are unclear and different in different parts of the syllabus. She has no respect and very hard to talk to. She can't her own instructions causing incorrect grading.

Prof. Stephens was awesome! She requires a textbook, but if you go to class you dont need it. We did a group project that lasted the entire semester, so homework is very minimal. She really wants her students to succeed in Research Methods, so she spends a lot of time making it easier to understand! Shes super sweet, definitely take her!

Sociology 1101 online, this class is SO EASY. No essays at all! Only one discussion post a week, which is a completion grade. You take a quiz every week which can be found on quizlet. There are no tests, just a midterm and a final, which can be found on quizlet as well. Seriously the easiest class.

SAVE YOURSELF THE STRESS ... DO NOT TAKE HER. There were quizzes for each unit and they were not found anywhere in her lectures or quizlet. You'll end up doing the entirety of the group project yourself. Did not grade or submit grades until the very last day grades were due. Save yourself the misery of dealing with an uninvolved professor.

So this class is a really easy elective. She obviously doesn't pay as much attention to this class as some more extensive ones because its an entry level class, but she is super nice. I missed a quiz and she totally opened it back up for me. Just make sure you participate in the group discussions and take the quizzes.

Professor Stephens did not engage in discussion posts. She waited until the end of the semester to grade all of the assignments. Professor forces you to work in groups, which makes no sense for online students. She does not update her video lectures. We were looking at videos from 2016! Apparently, this class was not important for her.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She says get textbook but I didn't and did perfectly fine, this class is pretty much common sense. No lock down browsers, you have discussion post a week but its opinionated. One time during semester you have to write an essay with a group but if you all write a para its easy. If you want an easyyyy A take her
there is a weekly quiz and discussion post. i never used the book and i was fine. midterm and final were a breeze. easy A with minimal effort

4 week summer course, easy A since its an intro gen ed class. What sucked was how Stephens was literally inactive in a discussion heavy assigned course WITH a GROUP essay which left you waiting for her to grade 80% of your work until after the final. She made it an easy A though but no one likes to be left in limbo about their grades.

Here's the deal, you want an easy A and get your gen ed credit, go for it. Discussions, "open resource" quizzes and tests, and the only annoying part is a group led discussion essay. Want to learn more about sociology? I'd hard pass. Also avoid the GroupMe if you wanna hear a bunch of whiners ask for due dates every week when it's in the syllabus.

Easy way to kick off my first semester. Weekly class discussion and quiz/test. Split into groups at the beginning of semester, each group does one week's discussion post and leads the class online discussion for that week. All quizzes and tests were super simple - just read the text and you are good to go. No interaction w/ prof the whole semester.

super easy. a discussion board post and quiz each week. powerpoint is the bolded words in the tb. all quiz answers are word for word on quizlet. and one discussion essay per semester . extremely easy A

Dr. Stephens is great! Very accommodating and sweet woman! Knowledgeable, but still accessible lecturer. Midterm, quizzes and final are all online and very easy to make A's on. Highly recommend Dr. Stephens!!! Seriously, don't take anyone else for this class.

Online social theory, very little workload but tough tests. Most weeks you just have to make a single post to the discussion board leaders. One week you will be assigned the DBL and have to make a substantial post. She provides supplemental material and powerpoints but no lecture and little follow up material. Take lots of notes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took this class thinking it would be an easy A. I ended up with an A, but it was very difficult. I have a 4.0 and struggled very hard with this class. You MUST read the book to do well. Also, you must be able to teach yourself. I think I have trouble with that and that is why this course was difficult to me. Teacher was not good at emailing back.
GREAT PROF!!! I absolutely loved her...easy, easy, easy.

I took this class online over the summer to catch up.  I thought it was just another boring Gen ED class, but Dr. Stephens made it interesting.  The tests were challanging, but if you read the book you're fine.  Because of this class, I am going to minor in sociology.  Great class!!

The instructor comes across as kind and genuinely concerned about students comprehension. The way that she words questions on tests is vague sometimes and she gives hypothetical scenarios that the answer could be one of two choices. I did not care for her testing due to her lack of being clear cut.

I took this class online and it was awesome!  Dr. Stephens is very passionate about Sociology and that came through in all her postings!  There were 4 tests and discussion participation - as long as you read the material you will do well on the tests!

VERY EASY CLASS! Does take attendance everyday. 3 online exams, make sure you have notes from WebCT and book beside you just in case when taking it. Nice person..class a little boring, but go. I made a 96.

Dr. Stephens is one of the most helpful professors I've had in my four semesters at KSU. She is fun, motivates students, and makes even the most cut and dry information interesting. I would definately recommend her to any student. She is an excellent teacher.
